page.title: 02FARMING-AGRICULTURE,Headcorn
page.content: This area of Kent is good farming land Most of the holdings are small mixed farms; many have larger fields growing crops of Wheat,Barley,Oats and Hay; a few acres of Potatoes and other root crops. The corn is Autumn sown and in Spring some fields are sprayed with fertalisers. As the crops ripen, these fields contrast with pastures of grass land left rough for grazing animals. When the hay is cut it is bound into blocks or large rolls,then stacked in huge barns till needed for winter feed Combine harvesters are very expensive, so many farms share machinery when the crops are ready for harvesting.Stubble is either burnt or left for sheep to nibble before the fields are ploughed and sown again for the following year.
